name: African Oceans Manor on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a luxurious property right on the beach (though about 7km from the centre of town). It has every amenity you could need: private garage parking, air con, fan, fully stocked fridge in room (with good prices for the wine), luxury toiletries, bathrobes, complementary port!! The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfast is sumptuous - with a starter! (we were offered a pancake stuffed with stewed apple and dried fruit - delicious), fruit, cereal, yogurt etc. and then a menu for a cooked or continental breakfast. We didn't have lunch that day. Staff were helpful and courteous. Unfortunately we were only booked for one night - I would stay for at least 5 on next visit.
reviews.title: Total luxury

reviews.text: What a great place to stay! Very comfortable, combined with excellent style and a "finger on the pulse" for what quests need. The staff are excellent and extremely efficient. Well done to all at African Oceans.... see you soon
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice rooms with a great view, access to the beach down some wooden steps. Bed and Breakfast only, no evening meal. Breakfast was very good. I found the place lacked atmosphere compared to other Guest Houses, mainly because of the obsence of staff. We stayed three nights, but never saw the owners, and only saw the manager on arrival and departure. This is a very personal opinion, which others probably would not find to be a problem. Should you wish to fish, there is good fishing off of the beach right below the Guest House. I caught a couple of Eagle Ray, and was broken off be something that didn't even appear to know that it was hooked, probably a shark.
reviews.title: Great Beach access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exceeded our expectations, a beautiful place, very well appointed, in a quiet area with great views over the beach. Lovely rooms, terraces and garden with small pool area. We were in what their website calls "standard room 9" - but this had two double bedrooms, bathroom and a large terrace! Very friendly welcome on arrival. Excellent breakfast. Secure garage parking. A point to mention though is that there are no bars or restaurants within easy walking distance so you need your own transport, or the services of André can be booked for the short taxi ride into town. Would definitely stay there again when in the area. We were travelling as a couple but would also be fantastic for families and groups of friends.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: really nice view over the ocean, nice hosts, beautiful rooms and silky beach infront of the house! unfortunately there is no restaurant but host helps with good recommendations. the president suite is a real wow! we will come back!
reviews.title: Lovely manor
Five Star Quality
reviews.text: We choose African Oceans as the last stop on our three week tour of South Africa and couldn't have made a better choice. This is truly a five star experience, luxury accommodation with magnificent views and the Indian Ocean literally a stone's throw from the villa. Freshly prepared food for breakfast with a delightful, innovative choice of hot dishes. The fact that it s a ten minute drive to the town centre made it all the more appealing and if you want to sample the delicious South African wines they will arrange transport to and from the villas for a very modest charge. Restaurants are recommended and they will make a reservation for you. Same day laundry service at very reasonable prices, garage parking, a decanter of local port in the suite (at not extra charge), a fully stocked fridge and tea/coffee making facilities with ground coffee available and fresh milk in the fridge. Nothing is left to chance, everything we could have wanted and more.

If you intend to conduct a Garden Route Golfing Tour and plan to play the courses around Mossel Bay then this is a must stay for you. Excellent service, 5 * accommodation with an Indian Ocean beach on the doorstep. Breakfast is the only service provided however, the management and staff will bend over backwards to provide you with your every desire outside of this excellent service. Each room is tastefully presented, and enables one to self cater for the duration of their stay. What more can one say but "First Class" and yes will definately be back
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: John B... Weymouth
reviews.title: Simply Elegant and Luxurious [and reasonably priced]!

reviews.text: I have visited Oceans Africa a number of times over the past 5 years. Whether for business or pleasure. I am always in awe of the beautifully maintained facilities, the lovely soft furnishings and the amazing staff that keep this well manicured facility rolling at an effortless pace. To add to this there are the sprawling views of the ocean that is simply walking distance away, promising beautiful sunsets and sunrises.
reviews.title: Fantastic rooms and perfect setting

reviews.text: We had booked 2 rooms at the African Oceans manor for our family with 3 kids and were welcomed and told we got upgraded to the weeding suite. The place is fantastic, they thought of everything, there is even food, coffee and candles for guests. The view is beautiful,direct access to beach. Breakfast was delicious and served with style. Kids loved it too. Staff is friendly and professional.
reviews.title: A Holiday to remember

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning!!! This guesthouse is a must stay. With all the bad experiences we previously had with accommodation, THIS gusesthouse was the best ever.
reviews.title: Stunning Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are friendly and helpful. The suite was beautiful and spacious and the breakfast is excellent. The location is right on the beach with stunning views. We were really spoilt. I am really impressed with this guesthouse and would recommend this to anybody for there stay in Mosselbay.
reviews.title: Exquisite accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful with the information we needed. They gave a very warm welcome. The service was wonderful and the room (suite 6) was immaculate. In the morning we had a very hearty breakfast in the beautifully decorated dining room, overlooking the bay.
reviews.title: Stunning views

reviews.text: This hotel is highly recommendable, if Mossel Bay is your destination. I wish I could have stayed many nights more!
reviews.title: A view and breakfast to die for!

reviews.text: Although tucked away in a residential area, this little gem has stunning views of the ocean. Breakfast was magnificent, taking in the view and our room (Suite 1) was perfectly equipped, very spacious anbd with a wonderful view of the sea from the bedroom and the balcony. Service was welcoming and discreet.
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you fancy being in a 'film se't with the most glamorous of rooms, suite 5 is the one for you. Every detail has been expertly thought out - even the unusual angles in the rooms. We had dinner platters served in the suite which was very good. There was only turndown on our first night (we stayed for two) which included complimentary mineral water. This was the only free water - apart from tap - all other guesthouses/hotels we have stayed at have a supply of complimentary water. We also had to ask twice for the Nespresso coffee capsules to be renewed. Breakfast was very good and the service there was also very good.
reviews.title: Glamorous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: African Manor was the last point of stay on our Honey Moon itinerary. Of all the places we stayed, this one was truly the cherry on the cake.
reviews.title: A wonderful way to end to our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personal service, excellent food, attention to detail and the terrific view of the beaches and sea it offered just sums up to one Awesome Experience!
reviews.title: Excellent in all ways

reviews.text: I would really recommend it to all people to have this amazing experience with them. Guests are really pampered!
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just one thing, do stay there as much as you can. It is a luxury not to be missed. Our only gripe was we could not spend more days there as we had to catch the flight the next day.
reviews.title: Just superb - thank you

description: Inspired by the rhythmic waves rolling onto the golden sand and the majestic Outeniqua mountains, African Oceans echoes perfection. Situated in the heart of the Garden Route, virtually on the shoreline, this is the destination to create lasting memories. The exceptional treatment, the unique and thoughtful touches, the luxury and comfort all add to the enticement of returning again and again. With superb staff and individual attention one should not pass through Mossel Bay without stopping by for a visit. Our rooms offer relaxation equipped with television, air conditioning, mini bar, coffee and tea facilities as well as private balconies/patios. Safe parking and electronic gate. We invite you to relax on our pool deck overlooking the bay and the breathtaking Indian Ocean. Nearby activities, among others, include elephant rides or a picnic with tame elephants, shark diving, game drives, walks with African lions and top golf courses. TGCSA 5 Star Guesthouse. Winner of AA Awards 2007/2008/2009 and the hall of fame 2010 & 2011
